sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution resolving that current economic policies must be reconsidered to bring and keep interest rates down, that the President and the Administration and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall discourage speculative lending, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall reconsider its tentative decisions to reduce the targets for growth in money supply for 1982, and that the President shall comply with section 10 of the Federal Reserve Act.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Domestic Monetary Policy.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution resolving that current economic policies must be reconsidered to bring and keep interest rates down, that the President and the administration and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall discourage speculative lending, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall reconsider its tentative decisions to reduce the targets for growth in money supply for 1982, and that the President shall comply with section 10 of the Federal Reserve Act.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Domestic Monetary Policy.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution directing the President and the Federal Reserve System to immediately rescind the scheduled decrease in the targets for the growth rate of the monetary aggregates until the current recession is ended.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Census and Population.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution to designate the sixteenth day of March of each year, the anniversary of the birth date of James Madison, as "Freedom of Information Day".

latestAction.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A resolution relating to public access to House of Representatives records at the National Archives.

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate, and referred to the Committee on Banking.
